algorithm_technique: Dynamic programming with precomputed next/previous character occurrences to handle palindromic subsequences.
problem_summary_simple: Count distinct palindromic subsequences in a string, modulo 10^9 + 7.
problem_summary_technical: Uses DP with memoization, leveraging precomputed next/previous occurrences of characters to efficiently count palindromic subsequences.
key_insights: The problem requires careful handling of overlapping subproblems and distinct counts.
Precomputing next and previous occurrences of characters significantly optimizes the DP transitions.
The modulo operation is essential due to the potentially large number of palindromic subsequences.
